bibl.title: Letter from Joseph H. White to the Office of the Surgeon General, June 1, 1920

div1.p: White certifies that Carter has immunity to yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph H. White to the Office of the Surgeon General, June 1, 1920
div1.opener:
Azov.- Sunday or Monday.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
McC:EM
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
June 1, 1920.
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN:
div1.p:
This is to certify that I, Assistant Surgeon General
Joseph H. White, associated with the late Dr. Ferdinand
Loeber, treated Assistant Surgeon General Henry R. Carter
in the Touro Infirmary, New Orleans, Louisiana, for a period
of one week beginning November 19, 1897, for yellow fever.

I also certify that Dr. Carter is now immune from
yellow fever because of having had this disease.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, J. H. White
Assistant Surgeon General. Visado en la Embajada del Perú
en los Estados Unidos de Aménca.-
En Washington, D. C., a 1' de Junio de 1920
C. S. Gibson
i Secretaria
gratis
EMBAJADA DEL PERU
EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS DE AMERICA.
